intro: Hydrophyllum congestum, commonly known as clustered hydrophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. Its leaves are finely divided and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The small white to pale yellow flowers bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
